SENT.plain: Dural venous sinus thrombosis, although relatively rare, has the propensity to cause potentially fatal conditions, such as stroke
This review presents the current endovascular treatment and management options for dural venous sinus thrombosis and provides current recommendations
Select databases were utilized for an exhaustive literature search with key search terms in efforts to obtain all relevant cases to endovascular treatment of dural venous sinus thrombosis
Recommendations for management options include initially the use of anticoagulation
For patients with a poor prognosis, local thrombolysis with urokinase or recombinant tissue plasminogen activator should be initiated
Ultimately, if the patient is not a good candidate for local or systemic thrombolysis, treatment via rheolytic thrombectomy should be employed
